verses.verse: (A Psalm of Asaph.) Surely <S%H389><s%> God <S%H430><s%> is good <S%H2896><s%> to Israel, <S%H3478><s%> To those who <S%H1249><s%> are pure <S%H1249><s%> in heart! <S%H3824><s%>
But as for me, my feet <S%H7272><s%> came <S%H5186><s%> close <S%H4592><s%> to stumbling; <S%H5186><s%> My steps <S%H9036><s%> had almost <S%H369><s%> slipped. <S%H8210><s%>
For I was envious <S%H7065><s%> of the arrogant, <S%H1984><s%> [As] I saw <S%H7200><s%> the prosperity <S%H7965><s%> of the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>
For there <S%H369><s%> are no <S%H369><s%> pains <S%H2784><s%> in their death; <S%H4194><s%> And their body <S%H9002><s%> is fat. <S%H1277><s%>
They are not in trouble <S%H5999><s%> [as other] men; <S%H582><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> are they plagued <S%H5060><s%> like <S%H5973><s%> mankind. <S%H120><s%>
Therefore <S%H3651><s%> pride <S%H1346><s%> is their necklace; <S%H6059><s%> The garment <S%H7897><s%> of violence <S%H2555><s%> covers <S%H9400><s%> them.
Their eye <S%H5869><s%> bulges <S%H3318><s%> from fatness; <S%H2459><s%> The imaginations <S%H4906><s%> of [their] heart <S%H3824><s%> run <S%H5674><s%> riot. <S%H5674><s%>
They mock, <S%H4167><s%> and wickedly <S%H9563><s%> speak <S%H1696><s%> of oppression; <S%H6233><s%> They speak <S%H1696><s%> from on high. <S%H4791><s%>
They have set <S%H7896><s%> their mouth <S%H6310><s%> against the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> And their tongue <S%H3956><s%> parades <S%H1980><s%> through the earth. <S%H776><s%>
Therefore <S%H3651><s%> his people <S%H5971><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> to this <S%H1988><s%> place; <S%H1988><s%> And waters <S%H4325><s%> of abundance <S%H4392><s%> are drunk <S%H4680><s%> by them.
And they say, <S%H559><s%> "How <S%H351><s%> does God <S%H410><s%> know <S%H3045><s%>? And is there <S%H3426><s%> knowledge <S%H1844><s%> with the Most <S%H9411><s%> High <S%H9411><s%>?"
Behold, <S%H2009><s%> these <S%H428><s%> are the wicked; <S%H7563><s%> And always <S%H5769><s%> at ease, <S%H7961><s%> they have increased <S%H7685><s%> [in] wealth. <S%H2428><s%>
Surely <S%H389><s%> in vain <S%H7385><s%> I have kept <S%H2135><s%> my heart <S%H3824><s%> pure, <S%H2135><s%> And washed <S%H7364><s%> my hands <S%H3709><s%> in innocence; <S%H5356><s%>
For I have been stricken <S%H5060><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> long, And chastened <S%H9640><s%> every morning. <S%H1242><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I had said, <S%H559><s%> "I will speak <S%H5608><s%> thus, <S%H3644><s%> "Behold, <S%H2009><s%> I should have betrayed <S%H898><s%> the generation <S%H1755><s%> of Thy children. <S%H1121><s%>
When I pondered <S%H2803><s%> to understand <S%H3045><s%> this, <S%H384><s%> It was troublesome <S%H5999><s%> in my sight <S%H5869><s%>
Until <S%H5704><s%> I came <S%H935><s%> into the sanctuary <S%H4720><s%> of God; <S%H410><s%> [Then] I perceived <S%H995><s%> their end. <S%H319><s%>
Surely <S%H389><s%> Thou dost set <S%H7896><s%> them in slippery <S%H9142><s%> places; <S%H9142><s%> Thou dost cast <S%H5307><s%> them down <S%H5307><s%> to destruction. <S%H4376><s%>
How <S%H349><s%> they are destroyed <S%H8047><s%> in a moment! <S%H7281><s%> They are utterly <S%H8552><s%> swept <S%H5486><s%> away <S%H5486><s%> by sudden <S%H1091><s%> terrors! <S%H1091><s%>
Like a dream <S%H2472><s%> when <S%H4480><s%> one awakes, <S%H9516><s%> O Lord, <S%H136><s%> when aroused, <S%H5782><s%> Thou wilt despise <S%H959><s%> their form. <S%H6754><s%>
When <S%H3588><s%> my heart <S%H3824><s%> was embittered, <S%H2556><s%> And I was pierced <S%H8150><s%> within, <S%H3629><s%>
Then I was senseless <S%H1198><s%> and ignorant <S%H3808><s%>; <S%H3045><s%> I was [like] a beast <S%H929><s%> before <S%H5973><s%> Thee.
Nevertheless I am continually <S%H8548><s%> with Thee; Thou hast taken <S%H270><s%> hold <S%H270><s%> of my right <S%H3225><s%> hand. <S%H3027><s%>
With Thy counsel <S%H6098><s%> Thou wilt guide <S%H5148><s%> me, And afterward <S%H310><s%> receive <S%H3947><s%> me to glory. <S%H9202><s%>
Whom <S%H4310><s%> have I in heaven <S%H8064><s%> [but Thee]? And besides <S%H5973><s%> Thee, I desire <S%H2654><s%> nothing <S%H3808><s%> on earth. <S%H776><s%>

My flesh <S%H7607><s%> and my heart <S%H3824><s%> may fail, <S%H3615><s%> But God <S%H430><s%> is the strength <S%H6697><s%> of my heart <S%H3824><s%> and my portion <S%H2506><s%> forever. <S%H5769><s%>
For, behold, <S%H2009><s%> those who <S%H7369><s%> are far <S%H7369><s%> from Thee will perish; Thou hast destroyed <S%H6><s%> all <S%H6789><s%> those who are unfaithful <S%H3605><s%> to Thee.

But as for me, the nearness <S%H7132><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> is my good; <S%H2896><s%> I have made <S%H7896><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> God <S%H3068><s%> my refuge, <S%H4268><s%> That I may tell <S%H5608><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> Thy works. <S%H4399><s%>
